meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the invention of computers.
meanings.sent1: The precomputer technology was simple and relied on manual processes.
meanings.sent2: Her precomputer knowledge of data management impressed the team.
meanings.sent3: In the precomputer era, people had to rely on handwritten records.
meanings.sent4: His precomputer mindset made him appreciate the value of manual calculations.
meanings.sent5: The precomputer world was filled with mechanical devices and analog systems.

meanings.definition: Belonging to a time before computers were widely used.
meanings.sent1: The precomputer documents were all stored in physical files.
meanings.sent2: She had a precomputer approach to organizing her schedule.
meanings.sent3: His precomputer habits included using a typewriter for writing.
meanings.sent4: The precomputer methods required more human effort but were effective.
meanings.sent5: Living in a precomputer age meant relying on printed materials for information.
